column2: SOUTH DAKOTA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: South Dakota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: possible hazards on roadways.
column8: no passing zones.

column2: 2. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Diamond
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 3. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.
column8: let them passÂ if it's safe to do so.

column2: 4. Drivers should make room for cars entering freeways by:
column4: moving over a lane if there is no other vehicle next to them.
column8: maintaining their speed and position.

column2: 5. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column6: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.
column8: following another vehicle.

column2: 6. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

column2: 7. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: park in the zoo area.

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
column4: A no-passing zone
column8: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 9. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: headlights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: narrow bridge ahead.
column8: road construction.

column2: 11. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: on the entrance ramp.
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Emergency line available
column8: Phone service ahead

column2: 13. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.
column6: stop as quickly as you can.
column8: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.

column2: 14. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column6: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column8: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.

column2: 15. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 3 hours.
column8: one hour.

column2: 16. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: come to a complete stop, then proceed.
column8: maintain your normal speed.

column2: 17. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column6: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 18. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 19. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: proceed normally.
column6: come to a complete stop and invite them to take the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and be prepared to stop.

column2: 20. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: under no circumstances.
column8: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle parking ahead
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column8: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 23. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 25. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
